prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: A new lawyer at my agency. She studied psychology while she was in Europe.
Character 1
Name: Apollo Justice
Description: An ardent young lawyer in my agency. His special feature is his very loud voice.
Character 2
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: My daughter, who also happens to be an aspiring magician. I adopted her eight years ago.
Character 3
Name: Sasha Buckler
Description: An orca trainer and performer in the Swashbuckler Spectacular. She appears to be best friends with Orla.
Character 4
Name: Bobby Fulbright
Description: The detective assigned to this case. He sure makes a lot of noise, but he appears to be on the side of justice.
Character 5
Name: Ora Shipley
Description: The orca accused of murder. Though "Ora" is her real name, people like to call her "Orla". She likes to wear hats.
Character 6
Name: Jack Shipley
Description: The owner of Shipshape Aquarium. He was found dead in the orca pool.
Character 7
Name: Norma DePlume
Description: An aquarium visitor. She seems to know something about what happened.
Character 8
Name: Marlon Rimes
Description: Shipshape Aquarium's new animal keeper. He loves animals as much as he loves rapping.
Character 9
Name: Rifle
Description: A penguin that always shoots straight at her mark. She seems to love the smell of fish.
Character 10
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: A spirit medium in training. Her psychic powers are beyond question.
Character 11
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: A prosecutor and prison inmate. He has mastered the use of psychological manipulation in courtroom battles.
Character 12
Name: Herman Crab
Description: Shipshape Aquarium's resident vet. A baby penguin lives in his hair.
Character 13
Name: Azura Summers
Description: The trainer who preceded Sasha. She died during a show on July 20th last year.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Swashbuckler Flyer
Description: An advertisement showing an orca dressed up like a pirate. It was dropped by a penguin. An advertisement for a new show. It was dropped by a penguin. An advertisement for a new show. It appears that Sasha was not slated to return.
Evidence 2
Name: Photo of the Body
Description: A crime scene photo taken in the orca pool room. It's hard to make out details of the body. Crime scene photos taken in the orca pool room. (2 photos.)
Evidence 3
Name: Orca Pool Diagram
Description: A cross-section view of the 1st- and 2nd-floor sections of the orca pool. The pool is about 65 feet deep. A cross-section view of the 1st- and 2nd-floor sections of the orca pool. Pearls apparently entered the staff corridor. It also has information about the area around the orca pool on the first and second floor. The pool is about 65 feet deep.
Evidence 4
Name: Whistle
Description: A whistle for issuing instructions to Orla. Anyone can use one to command her, as long as they know the right signals. Orla performs one trick per signal. She can't do two at a time.
Evidence 5
Name: Security Footage
Description: Video showing the orca pool from the visitor's corridor. The footage starts at the aquarium's 10 AM opening time. Video showing the orca pool. The footage starts at the aquarium's 10 AM opening time. (2 pages.)
Evidence 6
Name: Fish
Description: A large quantity of fish for feeding Rifle the penguin. Not surprisingly, it has a horribly fishy smell!
Evidence 7
Name: Walkie-Talkie
Description: Issued to all aquarium staff for communication. It can apparently also be used to broadcast inside the aquarium.
Evidence 8
Name: Calendar
Description: A penguin-shaped calendar that Pearls bought at the aquarium. It smells fishy for some reason. Apparently belongs to Rimes. It was accidently [sic] switched with Pearls's calendar around 10:10 AM. Apparently belongs to Sasha. A meeting with the victim was scheduled for 7 AM on the 20th. It turns out this doesn't belong to Sasha. A meeting with the victim was scheduled for 7 AM on the 20th. A calendar that Azura Summers gave to Dr. Crab. A meeting with the victim was scheduled for 7 AM on the 20th.
Evidence 9
Name: Bloodstained Coin
Description: A single coin seems to have fallen by the side of the orca pool. Discovered by the side of the orca pool. There are 300 coins in all, weighing 7 pounds total. This makes it a likely murder weapon.
Evidence 10
Name: Swashbuckler Video
Description: A TV recording of a performance featuring Orla, Sasha and Jack Shipley as pirates. The show song on the video is different from the one DePlume heard.
Evidence 11
Name: TV Phone
Description: A cell phone used by Shipshape Aquarium staff. This model can connect to TVs and be used to conduct teleconferencing. Summers's boyfriend has videos of her using a whistle to make the orca do tricks. A cell phone used by Shipshape Aquarium staff. Videos of Summers can be viewed. (2 pages.)
Evidence 12
Name: Shipley's Data
Description: Instant death from a brain contusion. There are signs of blunt force trauma all over the body. [info] Cause of Death: Contusion from head trauma. Bruised all over body. Death thought to be result of orca attack. Estimated Time of Death: Under Investigation. Instant death from a brain contusion. There are signs of blunt force trauma all over the body. Details updated. [info] Est. Time of Death: From 12:00 to 10:00 AM on July 20th. Cause of Death: Contusion from head trauma. Thought to be from 65-ft fall into pool. Bruised all over. Ceiling to pool bottom is 100 ft. Blow to head received after death. Shipley's walkie-talkie hasn't been found. (3 pages.)
Evidence 13
Name: "The Killer Killer Whale"
Description: A nonfiction book by Norma DePlume. It's about the case from last year.
Evidence 14
Name: Security Card
Description: A key card for gaining access to the orca pool. Only the victim and Sasha had one.
Evidence 15
Name: Prescription Bag
Description: Seized from Sasha's residence. She apparently had this filled at the Hickfield Clinic.
Evidence 16
Name: Skull Rock
Description: There's a bloodstain on the rock. The victim may have struck it when he fell to his death. A new show prop that was at the orca pool. The victim struck it when he fell. Moved from the show pool during cleaning time. The victim struck it when he fell to his death. The victim slammed into it when he fell. Orla also rammed into it. It had been moved from the show pool.
Evidence 17
Name: Pool Bottom Photo
Description: A photo of the bottom of the pool. The locations of the bloodstains detected with luminol are sketched in. [caption] The pool is partitioned into two sections by a tall glass.
Evidence 18
Name: Mysterious Capsule → "3 Zs" Sleeping Pill
Description: The strange capsule that was found in Orla's stomach. "3 Zs" is printed on it. The strange capsule that was found in Orla's stomach. It's a sleeping pill, not some kind of poison.
Evidence 19
Name: Handmade Sign
Description: A sign Sasha made for the new show. It's been left to dry since the early hours of the 20th.
Evidence 20
Name: Ladder Prints
Description: The fingerprints discovered by Pearls at the show stage. They're Rimes's, but there's something odd about them.
Evidence 21
Name: Charm
Description: Discovered in Rifle's stomach. It might belong to Azura Summers's boyfriend.
Evidence 22
Name: TORPEDO Data
Description: TORPEDO data shows that Rifle ate around 4:00 AM on July 20th, but that Orla didn't eat anything.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: In the early morning hours of July 20th, Sasha was cleaning the orca pool room.
Person: Crab
Testimony 1
Testimony: Sasha and Jack Shipley, the owner, were scheduled to do the cleaning together.
Person: Crab
Testimony 2
Testimony: The record of card usage shows that Sasha entered the orca pool room.
Person: Crab
Testimony 3
Testimony: During cleaning, the pool water is drained.
Person: Crab
Testimony 4
Testimony: While the cleaning was going on, Marlon was taking care of the orca in the show pool.
Person: Crab
Testimony 5
Testimony: The pool water would never be drained unless the pool was being cleaned.
Person: Crab
Testimony 6
Testimony: If there were no water in the pool, the orca might die.
Person: Crab

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's try to figure this out. So, I'm looking at the evidence and testimonies provided, and I need to find a pair that contradicts each other. The user wants just one pair, so I shouldn't get overwhelmed by all the information.

First, I'll start by skimming through the evidence list. Evidence 12 is Shipley's Data, which mentions that Shipley's walkie-talkie hasn't been found. It also says the estimated time of death is from 12:00 to 10:00 AM on July 20th, and the cause of death is a brain contusion from a 65-foot fall into the pool. Additionally, it notes that there's blunt force trauma all over the body.

Now, looking at the testimonies, Testimony 0 says that during cleaning, the pool water is drained. Testimony 1 mentions that Sasha and Jack Shipley were scheduled to clean together. Testimony 2 says the record shows Sasha entered the orca pool room. Testimony 3 mentions that while cleaning, the pool water is drained. Testimony 4 states that Marlon was taking care of the orca in the show pool. Testimony 5 points out that the pool water isn't drained unless being cleaned, and Testimony 6 notes that if the pool had no water, the orca might die.

So, putting this together, Testimony 0 and Testimony 3 both say that during cleaning, the pool water is drained. That seems consistent. But wait, Shipley's Data says the walkie-talkie hasn't been found. That seems unrelated, but then I notice that Testimony 5 mentions that the pool water isn't drained unless being cleaned. So, if the pool was cleaned, the water would be drained, which aligns with Testimony 0 and 3. However, Shipley's Data doesn't mention anything about the walkie-talkie being found or not, so maybe that's not the contradiction.

Wait, maybe I'm missing something. Let me double-check. Testimony 5 says the pool water isn't drained unless cleaning, and Testimony 0 and 3 confirm that during cleaning, it's drained. So, these testimonies support each other, not contradict. 

Now, looking back, maybe the contradiction is elsewhere. Shipley's Data says the estimated time of death is from 12:00 to 10:00 AM, but Testimony 0 says the pool was being cleaned in the early morning hours of July 20th. If the pool was cleaned and the water was drained, that would mean the orca was out of the water. However, Shipley's Data suggests the victim (Jack Shipley) died from a fall into the pool, which would mean the pool was filled. This creates a contradiction because if the pool was being cleaned, it wouldn't be filled, so the victim couldn't have fallen into it.

So, the contradiction is between Shipley's Data stating the cause of death as a fall into the pool and the testimonies indicating the pool was drained during cleaning. That makes sense because if the pool was cleaned, it wouldn't be filled with water, so the victim couldn't have drowned in it.
</think>

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's try to figure this out. So, I have this case involving an orca trainer named Sasha and an orca named Orla. The victim, Jack Shipley, was found dead in the orca pool, and everyone's pointing fingers at Orla. But I need to find out which evidence and testimony contradict each other.

First, I'll look at the testimonies. There's a testimony from Marlon Rimes, the animal keeper, who says that Sasha was cleaning the orca pool room early in the morning. He also mentions that the pool water is drained during cleaning and that if there's no water, the orca might die. That makes sense because orcas need water to survive.

Now, looking at the evidence, there's a "Pool Bottom Photo" which shows the bottom of the pool with bloodstains. The pool is about 65 feet deep and partitioned into two sections by a tall glass. The bloodstains were detected with luminol, which is used to find blood traces.

The testimony from Marlon Rimes says that the pool was being cleaned, which would mean the water was drained. But the Pool Bottom Photo shows that the pool had water, as the bloodstains are at the bottom, implying the pool was filled. This seems contradictory because if the pool was being cleaned, it should have been drained, but the photo shows it was filled.

So, the evidence (Pool Bottom Photo) contradicts the testimony (Testimony 3 from Marlon Rimes) because if the pool was being cleaned, it should have been empty, but the photo shows it was filled with water, indicating it wasn't drained.

I think that's the contradiction here. The pool was supposed to be drained during cleaning, but the presence of water and bloodstains suggests it wasn't, which contradicts Rimes's testimony.
</think>
